item.description:
PRESCOTT PARK ARTS FESTIVAL presents

Sierra Hull & Highway 111

Sierra Hull & Highway 111 - July 25, 2012

For Sierra Hull, music is an art form that knows no bounds. No matter your age, or the genre you pursue, if you've got drive, and the desire to aim big, you can get there. Over the past three years, the young Ms. Hull has been nominated for no less than five awards by the IBMA. That's no small feat for a gal that has just graduated from Berklee College of Music, having attended on the award of the Presidential Scholarship - the school's highest honor. Oh, and she plays mandolin. And bluegrass with a pop twist is the sound she's been chasing since she was a wee lass. At 11 she was invited by Allison Krauss to open for her at the Grand Ole Oprey. We could go on and on. The moral of this story? You don't want to miss this gig. Sierra Hull will steal your breath, and maybe your heart while she's at it...

-Click here for Sierra's virtuoso playing.

-Click here for Sierra's lovely voice.

-Click here for Sierra talking about playing the mandolin.

-And click here for Sierra onstage with Alison Krauss at 11 years old! She's not just playing, she's holding her own!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

-These concerts are very well attended. Arrive as early as possible.

-Bring a chair or blanket - and picnic food if you wish.

- Meet by 6pm.  Music starts at 7pm.  It might be difficult to find us if you arrive after the music begins...

THERE IS A SUGGESTED DONATION AT THE DOOR.

CLICK HERE FOR WEATHER UPDATES

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
item.how_to_find_us: House Left - Near the water - Call me to meet
